Bones of Upper Limb.questionText: The spine of the scapula is continued laterally as the:

Regarding the clavicle, which is not correct:
options: It is an example of the short bones.
It is the first bone to ossify in the fetal life.
It is the commonly fractured bone.

Bones of Upper Limb.questionText: The most common site of fracture of the clavicle is:
options: Junction of the medial two-thirds and the lateral third.
Junction of the lateral two-thirds and the medial third.

Bones of Upper Limb.questionText: The inferior surface of the clavicle does not give attachment to:
Regarding the articulations of the clavicle:
options: The medial end articulates with the manubrium by fibrous articulation.
The medial end articulates with the manubrium by cartilaginous articulation.
The medial end articulates with the sternum by saddle synovial joint.
The lateral end articulates with the acromion by fibrous articulation.
The lateral end articulates with the acromion by plane synovial articulation.

Pectoral Region.questionText: Which of the following muscles does NOT have any attachment to the scapula?
All of the following structures perforate the clavipectoral fascia except:
Pectoralis minor muscle is correctly described by which statement?
options: Covers the third part of the axillary artery
Is invested by the clavipectoral fascia
Is supplied by the long thoracic nerve

Pectoral Region.questionText: Which statement about the serratus anterior muscle is TRUE?
options: It forms the posterior wall of the axilla
It arises solely from the lower three ribs
It inserts on the coracoid process
It is the chief protractor of the scapula
Separates the pectoralis major from the breast.
Pierced by the lateral pectoral nerve.

Pectoral Region.questionText: Muscle/s taking origin from the clavicle is/are:

options: Deltoid branch of the lateral thoracic artery.
Apical group of axillary lymph nodes.

Pectoral Region.questionText: Regarding the serratus anterior muscle all statements are true EXCEPT:
options: It arises from upper eight ribs.
It is supplied by the thoracodorsal nerve.
It rotates the scapula during overhead raising of the arm.
Its paralysis produces winging of the scapula.
Has a nipple that is usually located opposite the 6th intercostal space.
Has Cooper's ligament that suspends the breast.
Has a bed formed mainly by the serratus anterior muscle.
Its lymphatics drain mainly in the parasternal lymph nodes.

Shoulder Region.questionText: These muscles form a musculotendinous cuff for the shoulder joint, EXCEPT:

The muscle, other than the deltoid, which abducts the shoulder joint is:
The muscle pair that assists in elevating the arm above the head is:
The nerve exposed by transecting the infraspinatus muscle and reflecting it toward the humerus is the:
Medial rotation of the arm is produced by the following muscles Except:
The glenoid cavity articulates with the head of the humerus by a:

options: Muscle inserted into the upper impression of the greater tuberosity of the humerus.
Muscle inserted into the middle impression of the greater tuberosity of the humerus.
Muscle that initiates abduction of the arm.

Shoulder Region.questionText: Lesion of the axillary nerve causes:
The trapezius muscle is supplied by the:
One of the following muscles is not a rotator cuff muscle:

options: Ventral lip of the medial border of the scapula.
Dorsal lip of the medial border of the scapula.
Upper lip of the crest of the spine.
Lower lip of the crest of the spine.

Shoulder Region.questionText: Muscles that rotate the scapula upward are attached to the:
options: Ventral lip of the medial border of the scapula.
Dorsal lip of the medial border of the scapula.
Upper lip of the crest of the spine.
Lower lip of the crest of the spine.

Shoulder Region.questionText: Paralysis of the deltoid muscle causes:
options: Loss of abduction of the arm from zero to 15°.
Loss of abduction of the arm from 15°-90°.
Loss of abduction of the arm from zero to 90°.
Loss of abduction of the arm from 90°-180°.

options: Posterior primary rami of thoracic nerves

The usual number of branches of the lateral cord of the brachial plexus:

Lower part of the axillary vein.

Axilla.questionText: Lymphatics from the skin of the back above the iliac crest drain into the:
options: Pectoral group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Subscapular group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Central group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Apical group of the axillary lymph nodes.

Axilla.questionText: Lymphatics that accompany the cephalic vein drain into the:
options: Pectoral group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Subscapular group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Central group of the axillary lymph nodes.

Lateral group of the axillary lymph nodes.

options: Pectoral group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Subscapular group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Central group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Apical group of the axillary lymph nodes.

Axilla.questionText: Lymphatics from the nipple and areola drain into the:
options: Pectoral group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Subscapular group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Central group of the axillary lymph nodes.
Apical group of the axillary lymph nodes.

Axilla.questionText: Regarding the axilla, one is INCORRECT:
options: The axillary artery terminates at the lower border of teres major.
The brachial plexus terminates at the lower border of the pectoralis minor.
The third part of the axillary artery is related to the cords of the brachial plexus.
The axillary lymph nodes receive 75% of the lymphatics of the breast.
The anterior fold of the axilla is higher than the posterior fold.

Axilla.questionText: The anterior wall of the axilla is formed by all of the following EXCEPT:

options: Muscle that abducts the arm from zero to15°.
Muscle that abducts the arm from 15°-90°.
Muscle that forms the rounded contour of the shoulder.

options: Circumflex scapular artery and radial nerve
Axillary nerve and posterior circumflex humeral artery

Axillary nerve and profunda brachii artery

options: Loss of opposition of the thumb
Loss of sensation over the hypothenar eminence
Loss of sensation over the thenar eminence

Arm.questionText: Regarding the biceps brachii, one is INCORRECT:

Has short head attached to the tip of the coracoid process
